items.title: All Terrain
items.description: All-terrain tires offer drivers traction on- and off-road, and are typically used by light truck and SUV drivers who want a tire that's able to climb rocks and perform on the highway.

items.title: All Season
items.description: Most common: Good handle on dry, wet or snow

items.title: Highway
items.description: Highway terrain tires are commonly used on light trucks and SUVs that typically haul materials or need to conquer highways and some off-road terrains.

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

items.title: Mud Terrain
items.description: Mud Terrain tires offer drivers traction on off-road terrains such as mud, dirt, sand, gravel, and rock, and are commonly used on CUVs, SUVs, light trucks, and jeeps.

items.title: Summer
items.description: For dry roads and warm, arid climates

items.title: All Weather
items.description: Combines an All Season and Winter tire traits for strong traction year-round

items.title: Sport
items.description: Sport Trucks typically feature a wide, low profile and offer drivers responsive handling and strong traction on paved roads.

items.title: Performance
items.description: For sport/luxury vehicles and high-speed handling

content.body:
### Shop 275/60R20 Tire Size 275/60R20 tires are commonly used on bigger vehicles such as light trucks and SUVs. There’s a good chance your ride has 275/60R20 tires if you drive a Chevrolet Suburban, Ford F-150, GMC Yukon XL, Infiniti QX80, Nissan Armada, or RAM 1500, and a brand-new version of one of these vehicles might roll out of the factory with a set of General Grabber HTS60, Hankook Dynapro AT2 (RF11), Continental CrossContact LX20, [Bridgestone Dueler H/T 684 II](https://simpletire.com/brands/bridgestone-tires/dueler-h-t-684-ii), Michelin Latitude Tour HP, or Goodyear Wrangler SR-A tires attached. Popular vehicles: 2019-2021 Chevrolet Silverado 1500
2021 Ford F-150
2021 GMC Yukon XL
2014-2021 Infiniti QX80
2008-2021 Nissan Armada
2011-2021 RAM 1500 All-season tires are the most common tire type on the road today thanks to their ability to perform well in dry, wet, and light winter weather conditions. Check out the Michelin Defender LTX M/S, [Pirelli Scorpion Verde All Season Plus II](https://simpletire.com/brands/pirelli-tires/scorpion-verde-all-season-plus-ii), Firestone Destination LE3, or Kumho Crugen HP71 if you want a set of 275/60R20 tires for your light truck or SUV that performs year-round. Drivers of light trucks and SUVs who haul heavier materials and visit job sites from time to time might need something that’s able to perform better off-road than an all-season tires. Highway terrain tires are built to help drivers haul heavier loads too and from a job site, so take a look at the Continental TerrainContact H/T, Yokohama Geolandar H/T G056, [Nitto Dura Grappler](https://simpletire.com/brands/nitto-tires/dura-grappler), or Nexen Roadian HTX RH5 if you need a set of 275/60R20 tires that can confidently get you to and from the job site. Not all drivers want to keep their ride on paved roads, and light truck and SUV drivers are no different. Fortunately, all-terrain tires are built with aggressive tread pattern and reinforced constructions for extra traction and durability off-road. Consider the Toyo Open Country A/T III, Falken Wildpeak A/T3W, BFGoodrich All-Terrain T/A KO2, or [General Grabber A/TX](https://simpletire.com/brands/general-tires/grabber-a-tx) if you want a set of 275/60R20 tires that are built to perform on- and off-road. Whether you drive a Ford F-150, Nissan Armada, RAM 1500 or something else, SimpleTire has a set of 275/60R20 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
